pullRequest.body:
This PR does the following:

- Make various theorems take explicit arguments (as it's a bit painful to invoke them otherwise)
- Replace `lsub f` by `â¨† i, succ (f i)`, in anticipation for the former being deprecated.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
On the contrary, it's more difficult to use theorems with implicit arguments if you're not rewriting an expression!
If they are iffs, then it's definitely easier if you have implicit arguments ðŸ¤”
The ones I changed weren't iffs.

> * Make most theorems take explicit arguments (as it's a bit painful to invoke them outside of `rw` otherwise)

... by which you mean "inside of `rw`", right?

maintainer delegate
Looks really nice!

> * Make most theorems take explicit arguments (as it's a bit painful to invoke them outside of `rw` otherwise)

... by which you mean "inside of `rw`", right?

maintainer delegate

```suggestion
```

I think this line can be removed now (and add implicit arguments for `rank_lt_of_mem` and so on), since explicit arguments are used in most cases.

It's the same for `PSet`, although Github doesn't allow me to comment on that line.
Actually, enough theorems still use some implicit variables that I think having the `variable` block is still useful.
That makes sense.
You're making two variables explicit in a consecutive block of lemmas. Why don't you use `variable (x y)`?
I'm not generally fond of using `variable` with explicit arguments. It's easy to forget and end up with explicit variables in an `iff` that gets added later, for instance.
I see.

pullRequest.title: chore(SetTheory/ZFC/Rank): clean up file
